node.title: Habits that leads to Depression and how to come out of it
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
If you ever felt hopelessness( felt like there is no hope for anything happening good) then you have experienced the ill effects of depression. It is appropriate for me too say that depression is like an illness where it takes all the energy and pleasure out from you. There are many thing that can lead you to depression. 

![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmegGgkgVMhYJVtXEgofZ8a9PAWyDGgM45TausQHLymQqB/image.png)
PC : [Pixabay](https://pixabay.com/p-242024/?no_redirect![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmXTyRmk85Sc7vvfpkCjBLodneGJN8Hhgdekz3Ycv1BDX6/image.png))

In this post we will figure out what are the main habits that leads you to depression.
<hr>

**1 : Lack of Exercise -** Do you aware of how much important is exercise for our body, not only physical but also for your mental health. Have you ever gone for a walk in the evening or in the morning, there is so much energy outside that will make you feel alive. Staying in home all day and not doing any physical activity can lead to depression. 

You will become lazy and become oversize which again can lead to depression becuase it will reduce the confidence you have in yourself. 

**To come out of depression -** The simple remedy of coming out of depression is to start exercise. I am not telling you to go and hit the gym and become a bodybuilder. But a casual walk in the morning or evening can make a monumental difference if you are suffering from depression.

<hr>

**2 : Sleeping Habits -** If you have a poor sleeping habits then that situation is ideal for depression. It is necessary for human body to get atleast 7 hours sleep daily. That does not mean that you should sleep anytime and make that 7 hours, you should have a proper sleeping routine. Lack of sleep will make you agitated thus eventually leads you to depression. Again if you are stressed you will not get the sleep you want.

**To come out of depression -** Sleep at least 7-8 hours daily with proper routine like 10 PM sleep and 6 AM wakeup. If you take enough rest your mind is always clear and then it helps you to reduce the stress as well.

<hr>

![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmS6Lqdj4XuDRrQbofbNdaUhN5wyarnYUz8ZS8ckbfycCE/image.png)
PC : [Pixabay](https://pixabay.com/p-689453/?no_redirect)

**3 : Isolation State -** Keeping oneself in Isolation is one more habit of getting depressed. When you start avoiding friends and family, then you are getting into a situation which is ideal for depression. It is worst thing for an individual to be alone or to be isolated.

**To come out of depression -** Talk to friends and families atleat once a day. Talk about all the positive thing happen in a day, it is always important to be connected with other people no matter whatever situation you are in.

<hr>

**4 : Dont' think too much -** Negative thinking about anything is the major cause of depression. It is like a cancer to keep thinking about whatever has happened. See, you cannot change anything whatever has happened but by over-thinking about that you are doing more damage to yourself. These things are out of your control and by just thinking you cannot change it and eventually it will make you depressed. 

**To come out of depression -** Always try to redirect your attention to more positive things in your life than the things you cannot change. If you cannot ignore the fact, then what you should write whatever you have in mind and flush it. It will make you feel better.

<hr>

node.title: Focus on your Goals like an Eagle
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
If you have dreams then your are alive, if you have goals set in your life then you are surely going to achieve something in life. It is so much required in this era to set your goals be it anything. You can start the goals as small as possible. The goal can be writing a blog post on Steemit (that's a very well defined goal).

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/ad/The\_eagle\_says-\_%22look\_at\_tha\_boootey%22.jpg)

By Ashishpaul777 (Own work) [CC BY-SA 4.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0)], via Wikimedia Commons

Now since you have defined your goal, you have to be focused on your goals and the best way to be focused is to be like an Eagle. But why like an Eagle? Have you ever noticed an Eagle when it is waiting. They seem to be so majestic, poised and elegant when they patiently wait and scan the horizon. Now the real question is what Eagle does different.

**Being Focus** - Eagles have the tremendous ability to be focus on things what matters the most to them and just ignore what does not matter to them.

**Confidence in achieving something**- They seem to be the most confident when they see an opportunity. They know they will get success no matter what happens and they do not get anxious or frustrated easily.

**Strong Foundation** - Eagle always try to strengthen their foundation thus giving them the advantage of sailing through whatever storm comes into their way.

So if you are not like an Eagle in any situation be it looking out for a new job, or getting the college admission or even getting a good post payout here in Steemit then my suggestion would become an Eagle. Turn into an Eagle, you will sail through your goals easily.

node.title: What is Stress - The Good, The Bad or The Ugly
node.author: codingdefined
node.body:
### What Is Stress? 
###

Stress can be defined as anything that poses a challenge or threat to our or any individual's wellbeing is a stress. But stress is not always bad. Some stresses helps us to get going and are good for us (as I said the good or the bad, can be ugly too). 

![](https://steemitimages.com/DQmbGysLXmFnjwCjvLb8zXzQv7L5EDvzB7sHAR3AffDLNrU/image.png)
Image from Pixabay

The Stress response is the body’s way of protecting us. When we work properly it helps us to stay focused, energetic and alert. Stress helps us to put the brakes to avoid an accident, thus we can say it also helps us to save our lives. These are the good parts of the stress.

When we are stressed our blood pressure rises, breathing becomes more rapid, heart rate rises and muscles become tense. For me the most common symptoms of stress is that I not able to sleep, during my engineering I can hardly sleep for 2 hours before the exams. 

What's stressful for me may be quite different from what's stressful to someone else. For example, I get terrified on getting up in front of people and speak (in a toasmaste session), whereas most of the people I know do it at ease. Someone performs extremely well under pressure while someone shuts down when work demands escalate. Stress is difficult to define as it is so different for each of us. A good example can be observing people in a steep roller coaster ride some people enjoys it a lot whereas some shuts their eyes and waiting it to be over as soon as possible. 

So, my question to all of you **Was the roller coaster ride stressful?**

The conditions and pressures that purpose stress is referred to as stressors. We usually think of stressors as being negative, such as an exhausting work schedule or a rocky relationship. But, whatever that places excessive needs on you or forces you to regulate may be stressful. This consists of advantageous activities consisting of getting married, shopping for a house, going to university, or receiving a promotion.

### There are mainly four types of stresses
###
•	Eustress – It is a short term stress which provides immediate strength.
•	Distress - Distress is a negative stress brought about by constant readjustments or alterations in a routine.
•	Hyper stress – Hyper stress occurs when an individual is pushed beyond how much you can handle.
•	Hypo stress - Hypo stress occurs when an individual is bored or unchallenged. 

### How to reduce the stress at work.

1.	Recognize warning signs of excessive stress at work which can be due to trouble concentrating, losing interest on work.
2.	Reduce work stress by taking care of yourself by having good food, doing exercise.
3.	Reduce job stress by organizing and planning beforehand, so that you will not get extra pressure on last minute.
4.	You can even approach managers or employers to get assistance of how they manage their work stress.

### You can even remember four A’s to manage your stress. And that is 
###

Avoid i.e. Avoid Unnecessary Stress,
Alter i.e. Alter the situation, 
Adapt i.e. Adapt to the Situation and 
Accept i.e. Accept the things you cannot change.

“God will never give you anything you can’t handle, so don’t stress”.
